programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor join Captain Bryson Shaaber to fish the channels around Key West targeting big spring tarpon with live pinfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor launch out of Key Largo and fish their way up a creek filled with monsters.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Tony Young for a day of offshore fishing and free diving out of Islamorada.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head deep into the Everglades to target snook in the murky waters of Lake Ingraham.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.sub-title: "In a Camp Down by the River"
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: The Rivers are Life team travels to Memphis, TN for the 2025 Alternative Spring Break hosted by Living Lands & Waters. In collaboration with various educational institutions and nonprofit organizations, the volunteer river rat crew was able to remove thousands of pounds of trash from local tributaries connected to the Mississippi River. Not to mention all the fun had along the way!

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Dow employees, their family and friends, and Katie from Rivers are Life join the Ijams Nature Center for their 36th Annual River Rescue in Knoxville, TN. Cleaning up the same creek every year prevents trash from making its way into the Tennessee River. With the community coming together to participate in this annual cleanup, they educate themselves on the importance of proper waste disposal and serve as an example of how residents can do their part to protect the health of their local watershed.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: This spring, Rivers are Life proudly partnered with The Little Forks Conservancy for a stream sampling event along Michigan’s Cedar River—a vital part of the watershed that eventually flows into Saginaw Bay. - Held on May 17 at the Gladwin Conservation District’s Community Garden, the event brought together Citizen Scientists from across the state. Volunteers were divided into teams and sent to six different sites along the river to collect insect nymphs and larvae—tiny but mighty indicators of water health. - Over 223 specimens were gathered, from stoneflies and mayflies to dragonfly larvae. These macroinvertebrates are highly sensitive to their environment, and their presence (or absence) can tell us a lot about the state of the river. - The results? Based on initial identifications, the Cedar River shows signs of excellent water quality—making it one of Michigan’s prized Blue Ribbon Trout Streams.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Are you looking to make a meaningful impact on the health of our planet's rivers and watersheds? By becoming a River Action Member, you'll join a global community of eco-advocates committed to protecting and restoring these vital ecosystems. Members gain access to conservation updates, community discussions, and opportunities to support impact projects that make a real difference. River Action Membership empowers you to take informed action, connect locally and globally, and help ensure rivers remain thriving ecosystems for generations to come.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Follow retired firefighter Steve Heath as he embarks on the hunt of a lifetime deep in the heart of Texas. Steve was selected as a recipient of the annual Bucks for the Brave event, a special initiative by the non-profit organization Trinity Oaks, which honors veterans and first responders with unforgettable hunting experiences.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Louisiana’s Cajun Ninja joins Chef Jay Ducote in our latest catch-and-cook adventure. Tag along as they hit up the hottest fishing spots in Plaquemines Parish with Captain Shane York and turn their catches into authentic Cajun meals.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake joins some old friends on board the Fall Line in hopes of scoring big in the Bay Point Billfish Open. This trip will test the limits of all the anglers as the skilled captain and crew do the impossible in hopes of bringing home the prize.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin and Florida WaterSports pro Jeff Lange go deep off Panama City Beach to test the limits of a new battery powered reel. The results are surprising.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When tarpon don’t cooperate, it’s time for Capt. Justin and friend Ethan Register to have a competition for dinner options in the gulf’s grocery store.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger take Plantation Boat Mart’s new 36’ Invincible out to the swordfish grounds.

programme.title: Into The Blue

programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger break in their new Invincible Catamaran with a trip to fish out of Palm Beach with their friend Captain Dave Fields.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger fly kites with Captain Dave Fields for a great day of sailfishing out of Sailfish Marina in Palm Beach.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger take a long run out into the Gulf from Key West to sample the bottom fishing and the long range capability of their new Invincible Catamaran.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: In today's episode I am, once again, joined by Congressman Rob Wittman. We talk about The Sharked Act that was proposed by Rob months ago and has just now been passed by the House of Representatives. In hopes of clearing up concerns, I ask Rob all the hardest questions pertaining to his Sharked Act. - Contact - Call your Senator - Follow Rob Wittman on Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/reprobwittman/?hl=nb - Rob Wittman's website - wittman.house.gov - Get your FREE knot guide here - https://tomrowlandpodcast.com/knotguide - Follow all my Socials - https://linktr.ee/TomRowlandPodcast

programme.title: reel_animals
programme.desc: Embark on an unforgettable fishing expedition with Captain Dallas King in the breathtaking Nature Coast. Get ready for heart-pounding action as Mike and dallas target Redfish and Trout from Crystal River.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike Anderson hits the road for another awesome trip up to Venice Louisiana.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: With a free day before Icast. Trenton and Ryan go offshore to try and fill the cooler. Catching a variety of species and hoping to get their hands on a hogfish.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Crew is chasing Tarpon in Tampa Florida with Ryan Harrington. After a few close calls and grinding out the long days, they finally catch up to the Silver King.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.sub-title: BaitFuel Fishing Tour - "Thousand Islands Open - Day 1"
programme.desc: Day 1 of competition for the 2024 Thousand Islands Open out of downtown Kingston, Ontario.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.sub-title: BaitFuel Fishing Tour - "Thousand Islands Open - Day 2"
programme.desc: Day 2 of competition for the 2024 Thousand Islands Open out of downtown Kingston, Ontario. The field will be cut in half at the days end.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP & Bo end up catching a myriad of species using gear & techniques not often seen at the lodge.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP is joined by Capt. Richard White, targeting Yellowfin Tuna on light spinning setups at Tropic Star Lodge.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Louisiana's Wild Food & Award-Winning Cuisine | Hog Hunting, Swamp Fishing & MORE"
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Exploring New York City's Hidden Culinary Gems: Cooking Goat Brains, Lobster & MORE"
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Alaskan Fishing, Foraging, & Mountainside Cooking with Local Legends"
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Exploring Japanese Street Food and Local Surfing Spots | DIRT Japan: Kyushu"
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes. - In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledge—and point the way to the future."

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Shot through the neck on Fort Hood in Texas, Green Beret John Arroyo recounts coming face to face with his attacker and Jesus blinding his would be killer.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: An Honor No One Wants: A Gold Star Family is the immediate family member(s) of a fallen soldier who died while serving in a time of conflict. Ginger Gilbert-Ravella honors the memory her husband…American hero Troy Gilbert.

programme.title: Julie Higgs Spearfishing
programme.desc: In the series premiere, Julie embarks on an exhilarating journey to Costa Rica alongside two enthusiastic friends. Determined to land a monster first yellowfin tuna, Julie pushes her limits—not only guiding her friends to hook their inaugural catch, but also aiming to surpass her personal best: a remarkable 180-pound yellowfin.

programme.title: Life on the Line
programme.desc: World record fly fisherman Nathaniel Linville shares his journey from troubled youth and addiction to redemption through fly fishing. After hitting rock bottom, he finds purpose in sobriety and relentless dedication, ultimately rising to the top as a world-record permit angler in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Brandon fishes with Robbie Crosnoe On Lake Henderson. These longtime buddies are dialed into the lake like no one else.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This week we're joined by our good friend and Worship Leader, Rob Key. A tremendous musical talent that's chased the country music dream, but found his calling as worship leader at Taylorsville Community Church. Rob's love for serving the Lord is his top priority, but he certainly enjoys the great outdoors and especially doing a little fishing.
